items.description:

Kym

items.title: Mobile App Redesign For Developers: Iconography & Magic Numbers
items.description:
Even small details like adding Icons or providing the right amount of Spacing, can make a significant impact in our overall design and by doing so we can make a clean, coherent, and attractive UI for our users.

Mobile App Redesign For Developers: Iconography & Magic Numbers by Luis Pujols
items.description_markdown:
Even small details like adding Icons or providing the right amount of Spacing, can make a significant impact in our overall design and by doing so we can make a clean, coherent, and attractive UI for our users.

[**Mobile App Redesign For Developers: Iconography & Magic Numbers**](https://www.pujolsluis.com/mobile-app-redesign-for-developers-iconography-magic-numbers/) by [Luis Pujols](https://www.pujolsluis.com/author/admin/)

embedded_links.title: **Mobile App Redesign For Developers: Iconography & Magic Numbers**

items.title: Clean temp files and directories in your projects
items.description:
Another approach for deleting the bin & obj folders in each sub-directory of your solution. This time with the added thrill of git command line.

items.description_markdown:
Another approach for deleting the bin & obj folders in each sub-directory of your solution. This time with the added thrill of git command line.

items.title: Neumorphic animations
items.description:
This is a great little tip for creating animated concave and convex fancy buttons using our best friends Sharpnado.Shadows and PancakeView.

Neumorphic animation with Sharpnado.Shadows by Jean-Marie Parent
items.description_markdown:
This is a great little tip for creating animated concave and convex fancy buttons using our best friends Sharpnado.Shadows and PancakeView.

[**Neumorphic animation with Sharpnado.Shadows**](https://www.jmparent.com/2020/09/16/neumorphic-animation-with-sharpnado-shadows/) by [Jean-Marie Parent](https://www.jmparent.com/author/vkqzlqju83s2/)

items.title: Video Background in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
How to create a full screen video background in Xamarin.Forms using the experimental Media Element.

Fullscreen Video Background in Xamarin.Forms by Joe Meyer
items.description_markdown:
How to create a full screen video background in Xamarin.Forms using the experimental Media Element.

items.title: MVVM With Xamarin.Forms and JetBrains Rider
items.description:
Khalid looks at the Model View View Model (MVVM) pattern and how it changes a solution’s profile and his approach to building mobile experiences. Khalid is also using Jetbrains Rider, another popular IDE for developing Xamarin.Forms applications.

MVVM With Xamarin.Forms and JetBrains Rider by Khalid Abuhakmeh
items.description_markdown:
Khalid looks at the Model View View Model (MVVM) pattern and how it changes a solution’s profile and his approach to building mobile experiences. Khalid is also using Jetbrains Rider, another popular IDE for developing Xamarin.Forms applications.

[**MVVM With Xamarin.Forms and JetBrains Rider**](https://khalidabuhakmeh.com/mvvm-with-xamarin-forms) by [Khalid Abuhakmeh](https://twitter.com/buhakmeh)

items.title: Animate A Mic Drop with Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Khalid bashes together emojis and animation to create an animated mic drop. A useful article if you want to learn a bit about composing animations.

Animate A Mic Drop With Xamarin.Forms by Khalid Abuhakmeh
items.description_markdown:
Khalid bashes together emojis and animation to create an animated mic drop. A useful article if you want to learn a bit about composing animations.

[**Animate A Mic Drop With Xamarin.Forms**](https://khalidabuhakmeh.com/animate-a-mic-drop-with-xamarin-dot-forms) by [Khalid Abuhakmeh](https://twitter.com/buhakmeh)

items.title: The future of .NET Standard
items.description:
Since .NET 5 was announced, many of you have asked what this means for .NET Standard and whether it will still be relevant. In this post, Immo Landwerth explains how .NET 5 improves code sharing and replaces .NET Standard. I’ll also cover the cases where you still need .NET Standard.

The future of .NET Standard by Immo Landwerth
items.description_markdown:
Since .NET 5 was announced, many of you have asked what this means for .NET Standard and whether it will still be relevant. In this post, Immo Landwerth explains how .NET 5 improves code sharing and replaces .NET Standard. I’ll also cover the cases where you still need .NET Standard. 

[**The future of .NET Standard**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/the-future-of-net-standard/) by [Immo Landwerth](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/author/terrajobstweb-de/)

items.title: Can Microsoft Finally Unify Desktop and Mobile Development?
items.description:
Microsoft has almost made it to the finish line with .NET 5, their ambitious platform unification project. For the first time since 2016 — when Microsoft introduced .NET Core and created a parallel track for cross-platform development — all .NET applications will be back together under one roof. What about Maui and .NET 6?

The Long Wait: Can Microsoft Finally Unify Desktop and Mobile Development? by Matthew MacDonald
items.description_markdown:
Microsoft has almost made it to the finish line with .NET 5, their ambitious platform unification project. For the first time since 2016 — when Microsoft introduced .NET Core and created a parallel track for cross-platform development — all .NET applications will be back together under one roof. What about Maui and .NET 6?

[**The Long Wait: Can Microsoft Finally Unify Desktop and Mobile Development?**](https://medium.com/young-coder/can-microsoft-unify-desktop-and-mobile-34f08348178b) by [Matthew MacDonald](https://medium.com/@prosetech)

embedded_links.title: **The Long Wait: Can Microsoft Finally Unify Desktop and Mobile Development?**

items.title: Toronto Mobile .NET Developers Meetup - Mobile App Redesign for Devs
items.description:
Polishing and working with UI/UX design can feel intimidating and like we definitely need a Designer in our team to get out a production-ready app design. In this talk, you will be able to learn key tools, resources, and workflow you can use to start building clean and immersive app designs.

Toronto Mobile .NET Developers Meetup - 2020-09-15 - Mobile App Redesign for Devs - Luis Pujols by Toronto Mobile Developers
items.description_markdown:
Polishing and working with UI/UX design can feel intimidating and like we definitely need a Designer in our team to get out a production-ready app design. In this talk, you will be able to learn key tools, resources, and workflow you can use to start building clean and immersive app designs.

[**Toronto Mobile .NET Developers Meetup - 2020-09-15 - Mobile App Redesign for Devs - Luis Pujols**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wUcf37JcXPI) by [Toronto Mobile Developers](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCASHUenPcHRI0Aabp2QAl6w)

embedded_links.title: **Toronto Mobile .NET Developers Meetup - 2020-09-15 - Mobile App Redesign for Devs - Luis Pujols**

items.title: Webinar - Xamarin, MAUI and the reactive MVVM between them
items.description:
ReactiveUI is a MVVM framework based on Reactive Extensions, which are a cross language approach to functional programming. During this talk we will take a trip through Xamarin, MVVM, ReactiveUI and show the future state of Xamarin, MAUI.

Webinar - Xamarin, MAUI and the reactive MVVM between them by Rodney Littles II
items.description_markdown:
ReactiveUI is a MVVM framework based on Reactive Extensions, which are a cross language approach to functional programming. During this talk we will take a trip through Xamarin, MVVM, ReactiveUI and show the future state of Xamarin, MAUI.

[**Webinar - Xamarin, MAUI and the reactive MVVM between them**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o4p34vKXlNU) by [Rodney Littles II](https://twitter.com/rlittlesii/)

embedded_links.title: **Webinar - Xamarin, MAUI and the reactive MVVM between them**
